ThermalNeed.definition: Range of parameter values where occupants do not feel thermal discomfort and therefore, they don't carry out any actions.

BuildingSpace.definition: An entity used to define the physical spaces of the building. A building space contains devices or building objects. (Definition taken from S4BLDG ontology)

Inaction.definition: The Inaction class represents the decision of an occupant to not act and remain uncomfortable within a space.

BuildingObject.definition: An object in the building that can be controlled by devices, such as a door or a window that can be automatically opened or closed by an actuator. (Definition taken from SAREF 1.0)

StatusTransitionScheme.definition: An aggregation of SKOS concepts regarding the status transition type of movements between spaces.

UnitaryControlElement.definition: A unitary control element provides a housing for an aggregation of control or electrical distribution elements that, in combination, perform a singular (unitary) purpose. Each item in the aggregation may have its own geometric representation and location. (Definition taken from S4BLDG ontology)

Building.definition: A building represents a structure that provides shelter for its occupants or contents and stands in one place. The building is also used to provide a basic element within the spatial structure hierarchy for the components of a building project (together with site, storey, and space). (Definition taken from S4BLDG ontology)

PhysicalNeed.definition: Physical comfort need that could influence a behavior.

Report.definition: The Report class indicates that an occupant seeks assistance or files a complaint about their personal discomfort, but does not take direct action to satisfy their needs.

Occupant.definition: Occupants or residents of a building.

MarkovChainModel.definition: Class to represent instances of Markov chain models.

Habit.definition: Driver related to habits that could be causing a behavior.

InteractionConcept.definition: Types of interactions between occupants and systems.

WeibullFormula.definition: Class to represent weibull mathematical formulas.

PhysicalObject.definition: Any Object that has a proper space region. (Definition extracted from DUL ontology)

NonPhysicalNeed.definition: Non physical comfort needs (e.g. privacy, status, etc) that could influence a behavior.

DriverSet.definition: Set of drivers that could be causing a behavior at a specific time.

Thermostat.definition: A thermostat is a component which senses the temperature of a physical space and performs actions so that the space temperature is maintained near a desired setpoint. (Definition adapted from Wikipedia)

Interaction.definition: The Interaction class represent the interactions of occupants with systems within a space to recover their comfort.

StatusTransitionTypeConcept.definition: One time event involving occupancy status transition in building level.

SpaceOccupancy.definition: Occupancy percentage of staying in a specific space category in a building.

InteractionFormula.definition: Formula to model the probability of interaction between ocupant and system.

Coefficient.definition: Class to represent the value and name of coefficients inside mathematical formulas.

Property.definition: An aspect of an entity that can be observable by a sensor.

ShadingDevice.definition: Shading devices are purpose built devices to protect from the sunlight, from natural light, or screening them from view. Shading devices can form part of the facade or can be mounted inside the building, they can be fixed or operable. (Definition taken from S4BLDG ontology)

CustomProbabilityModel.definition: Class to represent instances of custom probabilistic models.

Spatial.definition: Driver related to spatial conditions that could be causing a behavior.

Behavior.definition: Behavior related to the interaction with buildings

Movement.definition: The Movement class is used to represent the occupant's movements inside or between spaces.

Event.definition: Driver related to events that could be causing a behavior.

QuadraticFormula.definition: Class to represent quadratic mathematical formulas.

NormalProbabilityModel.definition: Class to represent instances of Normal probabilistic models.

VisualNeed.definition: Range of parameter values where occupants do not feel visual discomfort and therefore, they don't carry out any actions.

Meeting.definition: Class to represent a meeting inside a communal space.

Driver.definition: A Driver represents the environmental factor from the outside world that stimulate occupants in their inside world to fulfill a physical, physiological or psychological need.

OperationalModeConceptScheme.definition: An aggregation of SKOS concepts regarding the operational mode of space systems.

LogitFormula.definition: Class to represent logit mathematical formulas.

Need.definition: Needs represent the physical and non-physical requirements of the occupant's inside world that must be met in order to ensure the satisfaction of the occupant with their environment.

AccousticNeed.definition: Range of parameter values where occupants do not feel accoustic discomfort and therefore, they don't carry out any actions.

IAQNeed.definition: Range of parameter values where occupants do not feel indoor air quality discomfort and therefore, they don't carry out any actions.

ParameterRange.definition: Class to represent the minimum and maximm comfort values with respect to an environmental parameter.

Window.definition: A window is an opening in a wall, door, roof or vehicle that allows the passage of light, sound, and sometimes air. (Definition taken from Wikipedia)

StatusTransition.definition: Type of movements to represent transition events between spaces.

Time.definition: Driver related to time conditions that could be causing a behavior. It also describes the time when another type of driver occur.

RandomMovement.definition: Type of occupant movements inside a building or space.

Device.definition: A tangible object designed to accomplish a particular task in households, common public buildings or offices. In order to accomplish this task, the device performs one or more functions. For example, a washing machine is designed to wash (task) and to accomplish this task it performs the start and stop function.

http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/Person.definition: The Person class represents people. Something is a Person if it is a person. We don't nitpic about whether they're alive, dead, real, or imaginary. (Definition taken from FOAF)

EnvironmentalParameter.definition: Class that represent a physical variable of the environment where the driver occurs. It could represent variables that impact directly on the comfort levels of the occupant.

MovementModel.definition: Probabilistic model to define occupant movements inside and between spaces.

InteractionScheme.definition: An aggregation of SKOS concepts regarding the interaction type between occupants and space systems

Equipment.definition: Class to represent electrical equipments occupants interact with but do not have influence over indoor thermal conditions. These systems contribute to the energy bugdet estimation.

Action.definition: Actions are the interactions with systems or activities that an occupant can conduct to achieve environmental comfort. Actions connect occupants' inside-world needs with the environmental outside world. (Defintion taken from obXML)

Environment.definition: Driver related to the environmental conditions that could be causing a behavior.

HVAC.definition: Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning (HVAC) device that provides indoor environmental comfort. A saref:HVAC is typically used to accomplish saref:Comfort.

ConstantValueFormula.definition: Class to represent constant value mathematical formulas

LinearFormula.definition: Class to represent linear mathematical formulas

OperationalModeConcept.definition: Types of operational modes for space systems.

UnitOfMeasure.definition: The unit of measure is a standard for measurement of a quantity, such as a Property. For example, Power is a property and Watt is a unit of power that represents a definite predetermined power: when we say 10 Watt, we actually mean 10 times the definite predetermined power called "watt". Our definition is based on the definition of unit of measure in the Ontology of units of Measure (OM). We propose here a list of some units of measure that are relevant for the purpose of the Smart Appliances ontology, but this list can be extended.
